info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:54PM MDT until July 10 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN YUMA AND NORTHWESTERN DUNDY COUNTIES... At 353 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles south of Pleasant Valley, or 14 miles southeast of Holyoke, moving southeast at 10 mph. Additional severe storms are located from near Wauneta to northwest of Wray moving southeast. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Alvin and Wauneta. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 249 and 268. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
